title: Product Manager - Anbox
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical's product management team are technologists who have a passion for delivering products and solutions that help shape market demands while elevating open source software everywhere. This is an application track for a product management position at Canonical on Anbox Cloud. Apply here if you excel at leadership, communication, and technical vision, and believe you can drive product strategy for the business needs of tomorrow.
   

  

 We believe that open source is transforming the way that enterprises solve their business needs. Although open source has been around for thirty years, it is only now fundamental to every corner of the software landscape. Going forward we believe open source will have an even bigger impact as it moves into specialised vertical markets. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies', starting with Ubuntu but expanding to cover every class of application on every class of compute. To deliver on that ambition, we select product managers for their intellect and strong drive to advance the open source community. Together, we aim to improve open source quality, outreach, and impact. Our product managers set the vision and the direction to ensure teams deliver the right products in the right markets at the right time. They push the boundaries of the technology landscape to identify and deliver products into new and existing market opportunities.
   

  

 Ubuntu is the world's favourite Linux, used by developers around the world. Canonical has created a line of products and services that address primary challenges for those developing and deploying software. If you have a passion for cloud gaming, containerization and virtualization, then you will love being part of our team.
   

  

 This is an exceptional opportunity for a competitive technology leader to:
   

  

* Lead the roadmap of Anbox Cloud features and drive our strategy of Android virtualization and containerization
* Work with our engineering team to shape the development roadmap for Anbox Cloud
* Define future business models taking into account the competitive landscape
* Engage with the cloud gaming ecosystem and leading customers, enabling commercial success and driving go-to-market


 This role encompasses product leadership and go-to-market strategy, ensuring that the product vision is translated into actionable plans and successful market launches. Our product managers are technology professionals with a software engineering background who strive to become business executives and entrepreneurs. We discuss strategy, plan product development, drive engagement, and promote the open source way. We oversee the entire product lifecycle from conception to delivery, blending technical expertise, strategic thinking, analytics, project management skills and effective communication to ensure products meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Lead the product development lifecycle, reviewing the priorities and goals for your product.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as engineering, design, marketing, and sales.
* Address common challenges across projects, align on priorities, enable informed decisions, and keep business execution on track.
* Conduct market research, analyse industry trends, and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities.
* Communicate your product vision, status updates, and key decisions to ensure alignment and manage expectations.
* Conduct usability testing, analyse user feedback, and iterate on the product to improve the user experience.
* Collaborate with marketing, sales, and support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and provide training.
* Contribute to the success of our sales team in winning new opportunities, reviewing customer feedback and participating in customer meetings.


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic results at high school and university
* Understanding of Linux and the wider open source software community
* Understanding of computer architecture, application development, data centers, cloud or devices
* Passion to write about technologies and the tech landscape
* A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the open source movement
* Curiosity, and the habit of continuous learning
* A strong sense of ownership
* Problem solving and the ability to innovate
* Outstanding communication skills in English, both verbal and written
* Ability to travel internationally up to 4 times a year for company events up to two weeks long


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Familiarity with a particular verticals (e.g. Telco, Finance, Industrial, Automotive)
* Familiarity with the technology ecosystem including Silicon, IHV, ISV, ODM/OEMs, cloud service providers and channel
* Familiarity with cloud native technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker containers & Snaps
* Familiarity with embedded and connected device technology and ecosystems
* Familiarity with networking technologies - ethernet, IPv4 and IPv6, routing, firewalling, overlays such as OVN/OVS, VPNs, SR-IOV, Infiniband
* Familiarity with Linux containerization and virtualization, including LXD and docker
* Familiarity with low latency streaming infrastructures, GPU architectures, and cloud gaming technologies
* Familiarity with Android, its components and its maintenance


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Trintech is a multi-award winning cloud-based Fintech provider and we're seeking a Customer Success Manager to join our dynamic EMEA team! As a CSM you will be responsible for driving adoption, satisfaction, and retention across a portfolio of customers using our Adra solutions. You will leverage both high-touch and digital engagement strategies to manage a broad book of business efficiently, while partnering cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Support, and Professional Services to deliver value at scale.
   

  

 This is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days per week in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Own the customer relationship for a large portfolio of Adra users across Norway and the Nordics.
* Serve as the primary point of contact throughout the post-sale customer lifecycle, ensuring successful onboarding, adoption, renewal, and expansion. Develop and execute Digital Touch engagement strategies for scalable support and value delivery.
* Act as a trusted advisor by understanding each customer’s business goals, challenges, and how Adra solutions support their financial operations.
* Monitor customer health metrics and proactively mitigate risk while identifying upsell or cross-sell opportunities.
* Collaborate with Product, Support, Sales, and Professional Services teams to improve the customer experience and advocate for customer needs internally. Deliver virtual or in-person training, product walk-throughs, and success planning sessions.
* Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, feedback, and activity in CRM systems.
* Contribute to customer education content and playbooks to support the broader customer base.


**Who You Are**
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* 2 years of experience as a Customer Success Manager or similar customer-facing role in a SaaS business.
* Experience managing a large volume of customers using Digital Touch or tech-touch success strategies.
* Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Tech-savvy and quick to learn new software platforms; experience with CRM and CS tools a plus (e.g. Salesforce or Gainsight).


**Bonus points for:**
* Experience supporting or working with accounting and finance professionals; ideally with a background in accounting (degree or practical experience as an accountant)


 At our core, Trintechers stand committed to fostering a culture rooted in our core values – Humble, Empowered, Reliable, and Open. Together, these values guide our actions, define our identity, and inspire us to continuously strive for excellence in everything we do.
   

  

*Should you require (or need) accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please provide your requirements to recruiting@trintech.com and we will work with you to accommodate your needs.*
*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: Head of Large Delivery & Support
description:
**Letar du efter en arbetsplats för framtiden?** 
  
   

  

 Hos oss är karriären din. Här får du möjlighet att styra den i riktningen du drömmer om och samtidigt vara delaktig i tekniska innovationer som idag knappt ens finns i fantasin.
   

  

 Innovationer som vi vet kommer rita om kartan för hur vi kommunicerar med varandra och lever våra uppkopplade liv i framtiden. Letar du efter en arbetsplats där du får vara med och bidra till det viktigaste som finns – relationerna människor emellan? Välkommen till oss på Telenor.  
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
 Som
 **Head of Large Delivery & Support** 
 får du en nyckelroll i att leda och vidareutveckla vår avdelning som ansvarar för projektleverans, service management och kundanpassad fakturering till Telenors största företagskunder. Du leder tre direktrapporterande chefer och får möjlighet att forma en ny organisation där kundfokus, digitalisering och affärsnytta står i centrum.
   

  

 I rollen ingår att:
   

  

* Säkerställa effektiv resursfördelning och högkvalitativa leveranser.
* Leda, coacha och utveckla teamet och dess chefer.
* Ansvara för och kontinuerligt vidareutveckla vår modell för leverans och drift
* Etablera datadrivna arbetssätt med fokus på kund- och affärsnytta.
* Bygga nära samarbeten internt och externt, samt representera Business Operations i tvärfunktionella projekt.
* Delta aktivt i ledningsgruppen för Business Operations och driva förändringsarbete.


 Du får leda en central funktion där både kundrelationer och affärsvärde står i fokus – och där ni tillsammans tar nästa steg i utvecklingen.
   

  

**Vem du är**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en trygg ledare med gedigen erfarenhet från liknande roller inom IT-, telekom- eller annan komplex B2B-verksamhet. Du har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom exempelvis ekonomi, teknik eller management och är van vid att driva förändring i organisationer med höga leveranskrav.
   

  

 Vidare har du:
   

  

* Starkt affärssinne och god förståelse för kunddriven leverans och support.
* Erfarenhet av att leda genom andra chefer och utveckla team mot gemensamma mål.
* En naturlig förmåga att bygga relationer och skapa samarbete över avdelningsgränser.
* En datadriven och lösningsorienterad approach.
* Förmåga att hantera både operativa och strategiska frågor parallellt.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska.
* Hög strategisk nivå


 Du är nyfiken, handlingskraftig och trivs med att leda i förändring – och du inspirerar andra att göra detsamma.
   

  

**Vårt löfte till dig** 
  
   

*Vi är bättre tillsammans.* 
 Hos oss möts du av en familjär och inkluderande kultur, en stark gemensam värdegrund och ett ledarskap som ger dig frihet och handlingskraft. Vi tror på att ge varandra förtroende och frihet att agera och fatta beslut, samtidigt som vi är där för varandra i med- och motgångar. 
   

  
   

*Vi stöttar relationer och samhällen.* 
 Telenor är ett samhällsbärande företag och här får ditt arbete ett större syfte. Vi skapar värde för miljoner människor varje dag och har ett kundnära förhållningssätt där mänskliga relationer står i centrum. 
   

  
   

*Vi ger plats för livet.* 
 Arbeta hemifrån två dagar i veckan om du vill, så länge dina arbetsuppgifter gör det möjligt. Resten av tiden skapar vi magi tillsammans på kontoret. Två give-me-a-break-days per år ger en extra paus och flexibla arbetstider hjälper dig att balansera jobbet och livet. Vi finns där genom livets alla faser och erbjuder trygghetspaket i form av bl.a. kollektivavtal, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet att skräddarsy försäkringslösningar som passar just dig, för ditt behov här och nu. 
   

  

*Vi bjuder in till en spännande karriärresa.* 
 Din utveckling står i centrum och hos oss är lärande en del av kulturen. Vi avsätter 40 timmar om året för att du ska kunna fördjupa dig, utforska nya områden och växa i din roll. Genom Telenor Academy och andra lärandeinitiativ får du verktygen och friheten att forma din egen karriär. När du vill vidare väntar möjligheter i hela Norden.  
   

  

**Sök till oss idag** 
  
   

 Vill du ta ditt nästa steg i karriären med oss? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Vi träffar kandidater löpande så hör av dig redan idag. 
   

  
   

 Om du har frågor och vill veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Joakim Ludvigsson Porath, joakim.ludvigsson-porath@telenor.se. Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökan via mejl. 
   

  

**Bra att känna till** 
  
   

  

 Enligt Telenors policy genomför vi bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat för samtliga rekryteringar

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Business Development Manager, Data Centre Solutions - EMEA
 



**Reports To:** 
 VP of Sales EMEA and the Data Centre Director
 



**Location:** 
 Flexible within EMEA (with regular travel across the region)
 



**About Convergint:** 
 Convergint is a
 **global leader in service-based systems integration** 
 . We are dedicated to delivering innovative physical security solutions to transform data centre operations. With a legacy of excellence, we are committed to providing local expertise with regional impact. In EMEA, we are focused on deepening our market share by acquiring new regional data centre accounts. Convergint was built upon a
 **solid foundation of 10 Values and Beliefs** 
 , which drive our unmatched culture, aiming to be our customers' best service provider. We take great pride in
 **protecting our customers and their communities' lives and assets** 
 with our solutions. At Convergint,
 **service is paramount—service to our customers, colleagues, and communities** 
 .
 



**Position Summary:** 
 We seek a
 **passionate and driven Business Development Manager (BDM) for Data Centre Solutions** 
 to strengthen our presence in the EMEA region. You will be
 **pivotal in growing Convergint’s data centre security portfolio** 
 . This will be achieved by
 **targeting regional accounts, securing new business, and building strategic partnerships** 
 across EMEA. This
 **high-impact** 
**role is** 
 ideal for a
 **hunter who excels at relationship-building, negotiating Master Service Agreements (MSAs), and delivering results** 
 in a fast-paced environment.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Develop and Execute Strategic Plans** 
 : Create a tailored business plan and sales strategy to meet ambitious regional sales targets, focusing on acquiring new EMEA-based data centre accounts.
* **Drive New Business** 
 : Target data centre operators and hyperscale clients in industries like Technology, Cloud Computing, and Telecommunications. Initiate at least five MSA negotiations annually for solutions like CCTV, access control, intrusion detection, and fire prevention.
* **Collaborate Regionally** 
 : Partner with regional account managers, the SES “deal desk” team, and product partners to deliver customised physical security solutions, from proposal to implementation.
* **Forecast and Report** 
 : Provide accurate monthly and annual sales forecasts to the VP of Sales EMEA and Data Centre Director. Align forecasting to achieve significant growth in EMEA data centre bookings by 2030.
* **Represent Convergint** 
 : Deliver compelling presentations, manage pre-qualification and tender submissions, and build lasting relationships with data centre clients across EMEA.
* **Travel with Purpose** 
 : Travel across EMEA to connect with clients, embodying our “Regional Expertise, Local Service” ethos.



**Skills Requirements:** 



* **Communication & Influence** 
 : Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders and deliver impactful presentations.
* **Energy & Drive** 
 : A highly energetic, self-motivated team player who thrives under pressure and is passionate about exceeding targets.
* **Analytical Mindset** 
 : Strong financial and analytical skills to address challenges, evaluate opportunities, and maximise profitability.
* **Tech Savviness** 
 : Proficiency in physical security systems and solutions, with knowledge of data centre security requirements, is a distinct advantage.
* **Mobility** 
 : Willingness to travel regularly within EMEA.



**Experience Requirements:** 



* **Proven Experience** 
 : At least two years of experience selling physical security solutions (e.g., CCTV, access control, intrusion detection, fire prevention) to end-user accounts. Ideally, in the data centre or critical infrastructure sector.
* **Negotiation & Bid Expertise** 
 : Strong negotiation skills. Experience in bid writing—a talent for crafting winning proposals and estimates.



**Education & Certifications:** 



* A degree in Engineering, Security Technology, or a related field is a bonus point.
* Industry-specific certifications (e.g., PSP, CPP, or data centre security) are bonus points.



**Work Environment:** 
 This role is flexible within EMEA and requires
 **regular regional travel** 
 . For mobility, a
 **valid** 
**driver’s** 
**license** 
**and** 
**a** 
**clean** 
**driving** 
**record** 
**are** 
**required** 
 .
 



**Company Culture & Benefits:** 
 At Convergint, we empower our colleagues to achieve greatness. You’ll
 **contribute to a mission-driven organisation** 
 with a clear growth roadmap for EMEA. You will work with cutting-edge physical security technologies to address critical data centre needs such as cybersecurity, compliance, and operational resilience. You will join a collaborative, regional team that values innovation, integrity, and customer-centricity. You can
 **grow your career in a company that invests in your development and celebrates your achievements** 
 . A competitive compensation package, including a commission plan, is offered.
 



**Ready to Make an Impact?** 
 We want to hear from you if you’re ready to drive Convergint’s mission of delivering exceptional data centre security solutions across EMEA!

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
***Are you a Data Scientist who thrives at the intersection of code, business impact, and applied machine learning?**
 Do you get energy from solving real-world problems with data, collaborating across teams, and making sure your models drive actual results for clients? Then we’d love to meet you.*
***Why Avaus?***
 We are the leading digital transformation partner for marketing and sales leaders in the Nordics. From B2C to B2B, we work with top-tier brands to unlock value from data and technology. Our mission is to help our clients build the marketing and sales capabilities of the future, spanning AI, personalisation, automation, customer experience orchestration, and modern ways of working.
   

  

 You’ll join 100 colleagues across Sweden, Finland, Germany and Poland. We have a collaborative, curious, and forward-leaning team united by a passion for data-driven growth.
   

  

***The Team***
 At Avaus, you’ll work at the intersection of business, data and technology. Our consultants are trusted advisors and hands-on problem solvers. We turn data into insights, build intelligent solutions, and enable personalised customer experiences — often within complex, multi-cloud environments.
   

  

 You’ll be surrounded by talented specialists in strategy, analytics, martech, and data engineering — and you’ll be encouraged to constantly learn and grow together.
   

  

***The Role***
 As a mid-level data science consultant, your focus is both technical and consultative. You’ll help clients solve real business problems using data — not just by building models, but also by advising on what’s possible, feasible, and impactful.
   

  

 We see an agentic future, and it is a huge plus if you come with curiosity or experience in agentic workflows (e.g. autonomous agents, orchestration of LLMs/tools, or AI-led decision processes).We’re increasingly building capabilities in this area — and we’re looking for people who want to grow with us.
   

  

*You’ll work on:*
* Designing and implementing machine learning models and experiments
* Translating business needs into analytical solutions
* Exploring new data sources and automating analysis
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams across Avaus and client organisations
* Advising on the use of data and AI to drive business outcomes
* Reporting to show-case the results we create for our clients


***Who are you?***
 You’re a curious, analytical problem-solver who wants to grow into a trusted advisor. You understand that data science is as much about people, processes and priorities as it is about code. You value impact over elegance — and progress over perfection.
   

  

***We believe you have:***
* A Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. engineering, computer science, mathematics)
* Solid knowledge of Python and open-source data science libraries Experience with machine learning techniques and experimentation
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure) and modern data tools (e.g. Looker, Snowflake)
* Comfortable working with SQL and databases
* Experience or interest in recommender systems, agentic workflows, or autonomous AI tools
* Fluent in English and Swedish


***Practical Information***
 Our office is located at Renstiernas gata 12, and we have a flexible hybrid work model where we both work from our office, the client offices and home sometimes. We’ll agree on the starting data and it is a permanent position with a 6 months probation period. You will report to the Head of Delivery and be in the Data & Analytics competence team.
   

  

***Apply now***
 Apply through our career page promptly, as interviews will be scheduled continuously. For questions, reach out to Ellen Lübeck, Head of Delivery. Please be aware that email applications cannot be accepted due to GDPR regulations.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**About the Job** 




  





 Want to be part of building the future of Sales for companies everywhere? Where AI Meets Human Communication!
 



 Our client is spearheading a revolution in Sales by empowering sales agents to excel through automated personalized coaching powered by advanced AI technology.
 



 They are on a mission to shape the future of sales for businesses globally, and are looking for talented individuals to join their amazing team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, software developers, designers, and more in their Stockholm office.
 



 The company is transforming sales professionals' lives worldwide—building more connected and efficient teams at the intersection of behavioural science and automation.
 



 The state-of-the-art AI technology is redefining how sales professionals learn to communicate with confidence and precision in every interaction. Monitoring everything down to the customer’s tone of voice, picking up buying signals and offering live advice to agents and managers.
 



 The team previously built and held leadership roles at industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle by PayPal, Sana and EF. We’re now building a new category leader in AI, solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally.
 



 They are located in Stockholm, Sweden, and are backed by a global group of prominent and heavy-hitting tech entrepreneurs and investors.
 



  





**Role and Challenges 🚀** 




  




* Design and develop machine learning models to extract insights, predict sales outcomes, and optimize coaching recommendations.
* Work with large-scale data sets, ensuring data integrity, feature engineering, and pre-processing pipelines.
* Collaborate closely with software engineers and product managers to integrate AI-driven solutions into our core platform.
* Deploy and optimize models in production, ensuring efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
* Analyse model performance, troubleshoot issues, and iterate on improvements to maximize impact.
* Contribute to research and development efforts to push the boundaries of AI in sales automation.
* Stay current with industry trends in AI, data science, and machine learning, proposing innovative solutions to enhance our product offerings.



  





**What We're Looking For 🤩** 




  




* Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, with expertise in AI-driven applications.
* Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy).
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP for deploying and managing ML models.
* Experience in handling and analysing large datasets, developing data pipelines, and implementing feature engineering techniques.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business challenges into data-driven solutions.
* Familiarity with NLP, time-series forecasting, or recommender systems is a plus.
* Experience in mentoring junior data scientists or leading projects is highly desirable.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional team.
* A proactive, self-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.



  





**What’s On Offer? 👀** 




  




* Competitive salary & equity package
* Mobile phone reimbursement
* Six weeks annual paid vacation
* Wellness budget
* Learning & development budget



  





 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Infrastructure Architect – IT Modernization & Optimization
description:
Role: Infrastructure Architect - IT Modernization & Optimization
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Kista 16440
   

  

 Is it Permanent / Contract: 4-6 months contract
   

  

 Rate: Best Reasonable market rate
   

  

 Is it Onsite/Remote/Hybrid: Onsite
   

  

**Infrastructure Architect - IT Modernization & Optimization**
**Job Summary**
 An experienced Infrastructure Architect with 15+ years of IT infrastructure experience to assess our current on-premises IT landscape and develop a comprehensive modernization strategy. This role will focus on delivering optimized, cost-effective, and scalable infrastructure solutions aligned with industry's best practices and future-ready technologies. Candidate must have worked in large enterprise complex environments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Conduct a detailed assessment of the existing on-premises infrastructure.
* Evaluate performance, scalability, availability, and cost-efficiency.
* Identify inefficiencies, risks, and technical debt.
* Propose a modernization roadmap (on-prem, hybrid, or cloud-native).
* Recommend architecture improvements to enhance automation and resilience.
* Deliver a cost-benefit analysis including TCO and ROI models.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance and security.
* Provide technical leadership across infrastructure design decisions.
* Document architecture recommendations and transition strategies.
* Support procurement by defining specifications and evaluating vendors.


**Required Skills & Experience**
* Experience as an Infrastructure Architect or Senior Systems Engineer.
* Deep knowledge of on-premises technologies (VMware, Hyper-V, SAN/NAS, etc.).
* Strong exposure to cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and hybrid models.
* Experience with cost optimization and capacity planning.
* Familiarity with ITIL, TOGAF, or similar frameworks.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills.


**Preferred Certifications (Bonus)**
* AWS Certified Solutions Architect / Microsoft Azure Architect
* VMware VCP-DCV / VCAP
* TOGAF / ITIL / Cisco CCNA/CCNP


**Key Deliverables**
* Comprehensive Infrastructure Assessment Report
* Current state analysis (compute, storage, network, security)
* Inventory and dependency mapping
* Identification of performance, cost, and risk gaps
* Modernization Strategy & Roadmap
* Future-state architecture design (on-prem / hybrid / cloud)
* Workload placement recommendations
* Phased implementation timeline
* Cost Optimization Plan
* Detailed TCO/ROI comparison of current vs. proposed environments
* Asset consolidation and resource efficiency recommendations
* Architecture Diagrams & Documentation
* High-level and low-level design (HLD/LLD) blueprints
* Security, compliance, and DR considerations
* Technology Recommendations
* Platform, tool, and vendor selection proposals
* Licensing and scaling guidance
* Presentation to Stakeholders
* Executive summary deck
* Q&A session with leadership and IT operations teams

title: Technical Account Manager till Nordlo
company_industry: Staffing and Recruiting and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Om företaget** 




 Med 900 kollegor på 45+ kontor i Sverige och Norge levererar vi tjänster inom IT-infrastruktur till kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Vi utvecklar våra kunder och stärker deras konkurrenskraft genom ett brett tjänsteerbjudande och skalbara lösningar. Vi finns till för att stärka våra kunder och effektivisera deras verksamhet.
 



  





 För att du ska må bra i vår organisation är ditt välmående viktigt för oss. Vi tror på en mångfald och arbetar aktivt för en jämlik och inkluderande företagskultur. Hos oss är det också självklart att du som anställd:
 



  




* Får en god balans mellan arbetstid och fritid
* Är delaktig och har möjlighet att påverka
* Har ett nära samarbete mellan team och kollegor
* Får ett lyhört och närvarande ledarskap



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som TAM har du ett tekniskt ansvar för ett antal kunder där ditt huvudansvar är att tillsammans med kundansvarig och kundteam driva kundens digitaliseringsresa. Det innebär att ni har gemensamt ansvar för att underhålla och utveckla kundernas tekniska miljöer för att ge kunderna de bästa förutsättningarna att nå sina affärsmål.
 



  





 70 härliga medarbetare jobbar idag på Nordlos Evolves centralt belägna kontor i Stockholm och Göteborg.
 



  





 Du kommer bland annat att:
 


* Agera strategisk rådgivare till dina kunder
* Ansvara för dina kunders projekt tillsammans med ditt kundteam
* Ta fram proaktiva tekniska förslag som utvecklar kunderna
* Driva leveransmöten tillsammans med kund
* Planera aktiviteter och projekt tillsammans med kund



  





**Kvalifikationer och egenskaper** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid din personlighet. Som person är du kommunikativ och engagerad. Du har lätt för att ta egna initiativ och trivs med att vara länken mellan tekniken och kunden. Du har ett öppet sinne, ett flexibelt arbetssätt och delar gärna med dig av insikter till såväl kunder som kollegor. Sannolikt blir du ofta beskriven som en nyfiken, social och anpassningsbar person och en person som känner dig trygg i olika situationer.
 



  





 I övrigt vill vi att du:
 


* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet i roll som senior tekniker
* Har byggt upp en god övergripande kunskap inom IT, har god teknisk förståelse och en övergripande kunskap kring IT miljöer så som: Traditionell IT-drift, Cloudlösningar såsom Microsoft 365 och nätverkskommunikation
* Har eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT/teknik eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska



  





**Övrig information** 



* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
* Plats: Stockholm
* Omfattning: Heltid
* Lön: Enligt överenskommelse



  





 Vi tillämpar löpande urval i denna process vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi rekommenderar dig därför att ansöka så snart som möjligt!
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar kring Asta Agencys rekryteringsprocess, tveka inte att höra av dig till ylva@astaagency.se.

title: Senior FinOps Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 In our Cloud Governance team, we are seeking an experienced Senior FinOps Engineer to accelerate the interaction with engineering stakeholders. This role will drive FinOps maturity towards full cost attribution and unit metrics, focusing on automations, tool integrations, prototyping solutions, and developing metadata strategies. The candidate will play a crucial role in mapping our application stack to cost and optimizing cloud expenditure. While this role has a focus on FinOps, other data or cloud governance responsibilities will be part of the job, ensuring comprehensive management practices. Those with a passion for innovation and cloud cost efficiency are encouraged to apply.
   

  





 Responsibilities
   

  




* Collaborate with engineering stakeholders to improve FinOps maturity and implement cost-effective solutions.
* Develop and apply automation frameworks to streamline financial operations and enhance efficiency.
* Use cloud cost management tools to optimize cloud spending.
* Promote FinOps practices to raise cost awareness and efficiency across the organization.
* Create prototypes to test strategies for cost attribution and unit metrics.
* Improve FinOps efficiencies by utilizing automations to reduce manual intervention and enhance real-time cost monitoring and management.
* Map the application stack to cost, ensuring transparent and accurate cost allocation.
* Develop and execute metadata strategies to enhance data quality and manage costs effectively.
* Stay informed about the latest cloud technologies and cost optimization strategies.
* Support the development of frameworks for comprehensive cost attribution and unit metrics.
* Assist in improving the organization's financial health and efficiency through data-driven decisions.
* Encourage a cost-efficient architecture mindset that optimizes costs while maintaining performance and reliability.



 If you are passionate about optimizing cloud costs, driving innovation, and contributing to the financial health and efficiency of our organization, we invite you to apply for the FinOps Engineer role. Join us in shaping the future of cloud governance and financial operations at a leading cloud-native company.
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  




* Several years of experience in a FinOps Engineer role or similar position, or as a Data Analyst or Software Engineer with exposure to FinOps and a desire to deepen their expertise.
* Strong technical skills in cloud technologies, including experience with AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
* Proficient in Scripting, Terraform, and modern software development practices.
* Excellent verbal and written communication abilities



 Preferred Qualifications
   

  




* Proficiency in using cloud cost management tools such as Cloudability or CloudHealth would be good.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and drive actionable insights.
* Experience in automation, tool integration, prototyping solutions, and metadata strategies.
* Solid understanding of cost drivers and financial principles in a cloud environment.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with various stakeholders across the organization.
* FinOps certifications or a willingness to obtain them.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Network Technical Program Manager
description:
*Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. In this role you will be part of building Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.*
**The Role**
 As a Network Technical Program Manager (TPM) you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the end-to-end delivery of complex network projects within our organization. This role requires strong technical expertise in networking, project management skills, and a proven ability to lead cross-functional teams. The Network TPM will coordinate multiple programs, ensuring that network infrastructure improvements and innovations are deployed effectively, within scope, on time, and according to budget. Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Lead and manage complex, large-scale network programs that involve multiple stakeholders. Ensure alignment with organizational goals, ensuring programs are completed efficiently and effectively.
* Develop comprehensive program plans, including timelines, budgets, resource allocation, and risk management. Oversee the execution of network infrastructure and improvements, ensuring timely delivery.
* Collaborate with engineers, network architects, vendors, and other cross-functional teams to design, implement, and optimize network solutions. Act as the primary liaison between technical and non-technical teams.
* Communicate program status, risks, and milestones to senior leadership and key stakeholders. Provide regular updates on progress, ensuring clear communication across all levels.
* Identify program risks and proactively develop mitigation plans. Address any issues or roadblocks that may impact program success and delivery timelines.
* Implement best practices and process improvements related to network engineering and operations, ensuring the highest levels of performance and efficiency.
* Provide technical guidance and support to engineering teams, ensuring alignment with architectural standards and best practices.


**Your profile**
* Years of Experience: 12+ years in telecom domain, with at least 5 years as a Program Manager
* Leadership & Communication: Strong leadership; excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to manage conflicts.
* Business Acumen: Understanding of telecom business models; ability to link technical solutions to business outcomes; experience in preparing business cases.
* Education & Certification: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in relevant fields; certifications like SAFe or similiar.
* You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com
